Comment: I suppose I can at least conceptualize the goal of reducing future loan limits. The availability of large, low risk government loans has been cited as a contributing factor for the rapid growth of tuition rates.  Limiting repayment options for current loneholders, however, seems dumb. Especially going into a recession.  Also, the requirement for 30 credit hours a year instead of 24 (which is currently full-time) is odd. Are they trying to prevent undergraduate students from extending their degrees to 5 years (which is common)? Why?
